alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 11:08PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garvin, Grady, Oklahoma, Cleveland, eastern Canadian and McClain Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1108 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to 3 miles east of Blanchard to 8 miles north of Bray. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, El Reno, Newcastle, Blanchard, Pauls Valley, Purcell, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Noble, Tuttle, and Piedmont. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 72 and 146. Interstate 40 between mile markers 127 and 173. Interstate 44 between mile markers 87 and 151. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Canadian; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma
